items.title: Marriage: God’s Pattern for Love
items.big_idea: Marriage is not an accident; it is a design. Scripture shows God creating marriage for companionship, calling spouses to a posture of mutual submission, and pointing to love that moves first. When a home follows God’s pattern, it becomes a clear witness through daily conduct, not merely words.

items.title: God’s Name and Jesus’ Exalted Name
items.big_idea: In Exodus, God makes His Name known as a lasting memorial for every generation, and He is celebrated as a mighty warrior. In the New Testament, Jesus is given the Name above every name, and God’s power is seen in extraordinary healings as people come near in faith. The same Scriptures also call believers to respond with a distinct posture—blessing even in the face of persecution.

items.title: Destined: God’s Counsel and Your Walk
items.big_idea: Many plans can be made, but God’s counsel is what stands. Scripture shows people marked by promise who still faced plots, temptation, and imprisonment—yet God’s purpose was not cancelled. This study traces how identity, integrity, and worship keep a believer aligned with God’s destiny.

items.title: Restoration Through Humility
items.big_idea: A new beginning is not the absence of pressure; Jesus said we will face tribulation, yet we can have peace because He has overcome the world. God promises His redeemed people His presence through deep waters and fire, and He is an everlasting refuge. But pride can sabotage a restart—Scripture warns that God resists the proud, humbles the arrogant, and gives grace and restoration to the humble.

items.title: Healing Power Through Jesus and Faith
items.big_idea: The Bible presents Jesus as the One anointed to heal and deliver, and it also shows that God’s power can be present to heal in real moments of need. From desperate cries to simple acts of reaching out, Scripture highlights faith that connects to Christ’s power. This study traces how God’s Word produces faith, how believers respond, and what healed lives look like afterward.

items.title: Don’t Stop Praying in Hard Times
items.big_idea: When pressure rises, the temptation is to stop praying—but Scripture points the other way. God reigns over kings, circumstances, and every obstacle, and His power is not limited by what we see. This study traces biblical reasons to keep praying with confidence, seeking God as refuge and trusting His authority to answer.
